heading: what does it do?
subheading: earlier this year, researchers at a us department of energy lab combined some ordinary household chemicals into a substance that could become a new tool for national security. the harmless solution can spray from handheld canisters or sprinkler systems just like a fire retardant. as the soapy concoction undergoes further development, military agencies, police departments, […]
author: wired staff
text: earlier this year, researchers at a us department of energy lab combined some ordinary household chemicals into a substance that could become a new tool for national security. the harmless solution can spray from handheld canisters or sprinkler systems just like a fire retardant. as the soapy concoction undergoes further development, military agencies, police departments, and transit authorities are all considering how they might deploy it - just in case.what is it, anyway? and what does it do?the wired contestthe rules: for a chance to get out and enjoy the open road on a harley-davidson sportster, identify the substance pictured at right (by creator) and its function. correct entries will be placed in a random grand prize competition, with one winner drawn early next year awarded a harley-davidson xl 1200s sportster. for contest rules, prize information, and the answer to july's "what does it do?", click here.__ win a harley-davidson xl 1200s sportster __
